data: ICU Organ Donation Neurological Determination of Death (NDD)
Consent for donation must be obtained by BC Transplant Service (BCTS) Coordinator
Ensure that Neurological Determination of Death (NDD) is performed by at least 2 licensed physicians and patient is an eligible donor
Ensure Medical Certification of Death and Notice of Death is completed (if applicable)
Ensure contact initiated with BC Transplant
Change medical service to deceased donor after first declaration of death

MAP goal: greater than 65 mmHg, SBP goal: 90-160 mmHg, Temp goal: maintain temperature 34 to 35 DegC., pH goal: 7.35-7.45, PaO2 goal: greater than 70 mmHg with minimal effective FiO2, CVP goal: 6-10 mmHg, Heart Rate goal: 60-120 bpm, SaO2 Goal: greater th
once, unless already done. Record on BC Transplant Physical Assessment Form
once, unless already done. Record on BC Transplant Physical Assessment Form
Continuous, remains on at all times
q4h, maintain temperature 34 to 35 DegC. Apply warming or cooling blanket as needed to maintain temperature
Hgb < 70, Plts < 10, Notify Provider and BC Transplant
Insert 2 large bore IV's if no CVC
Indwelling, if not already in place
X-ray post gastric sump insertion to confirm position
No suction, Tube for feeding, check gastric residual volume q4h
Clamped, Check gastric residual volume q4h
X-ray post gastric sump insertion to confirm position
No suction, Tube for feeding, check gastric residual volume q4h
Clamped, Check gastric residual volume q4h
Continue feeds if already initiated as per previous orders until the OR
Consider maintenance fluids based on sodium level. Ringers lactate recommended unless sodium level 130 mEq/L or less
order rate: 1 mL/kg/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 2 mL/kg/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 25 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
Assess all other medication orders once this order set is completed
Steroids not routinely given except in cases of shock
Manage bradycardia and tachycardia as any critically ill patient. Ensure patient is euvolemic. Note: atropine is not effective in NDD patients
Start if requiring vasopressors / inotropes or ejection fraction less than 40%
For Organ Donor management, give levothyroxine for cardiac donor
100 mcg, IV, once, drug form: inj
50 mcg, IV, q12h interval, drug form: inj
2 mcg, IV direct, once, drug form: inj
2 mcg, IV direct, q6h, PRN other (see comment), drug form: inj
Vasopressin preferred for patients with hypotension
vasopressin titratable infusion (0.2 unit/mL) in D5W standard
titrate, IV, 0.01 unit/min starting rate, 0 unit/min minimum rate, 0.04 unit/min maximum rate, titrate instructions: titrate to maintain MAP and SBP goals
NORepinephrine titratable infusion (32 mcg/mL) in D5W standard
titrate, IV, 1 mcg/min starting rate, 0 mcg/min minimum rate, 15 mcg/min maximum rate, titrate instructions: titrate to maintain MAP and SBP goals, after vasopressin at maximum rate
dose range: 5 to 10 mg, IV, q15min, PRN hypertension, drug form: inj
dose range: 10 to 20 mg, IV, q10min, PRN hypertension, drug form: inj
If lungs are not being considered for transplant, treat any known or suspected infections
Extended anti-microbial prophylaxis is not indicated if lungs are not considered for recovery surgery
If lungs are being considered for transplant, treat with [piperacillin-tazobactam OR meropenem] AND vancomycin AND fluconazole
3.375 g, IV, q6h interval, order duration: 7 day, drug form: bag
For documented or suspected penicillin anaphylaxis or history of Extended Spectrum Beta-Lactamase organisms, select meropenem
500 mg, IV, q6h interval, order duration: 7 day, drug form: bag
15 mg/kg, IV, q12h interval, order duration: 7 day
400 mg, IV, q24h, order duration: 7 day
Send blood for tissue typing and serology (Use BC Transplant "Red Blood Box")

Routine, Special Instructions: Order Chest x-ray daily, Transport: Portable
Order Electrocardiogram 12 Lead and Echocardiogram, if not performed within 12 hours

Urgent, Reason: Other (Must Specify), Additional Reason: while heart is under evaluation, for organ donation work up, Transport: Patient Bed
Order CT of Chest w/o Contrast, CT of Abdomen w/o Contrast, CT Cardiac w/ Contrast, Bronchoscopy if requested by BC Transplant
Continue mechanical ventilation as per previous orders

Mode: A/C or P/C, Vt: 6, Max P: 30 cmH2O, PEEP: Minimum PEEP of 10cmH2O, or appropriately optimized PEEP.  Adjust FiO2 to maintain SaO2 greater than or equal to 95% and PaO2 above 70 mmHg.  Maintain pH 7.35 to 7.45. Neurological Determination of Death. Ti
Consult site policy for procedure and BCT for frequency
q2h, and after all circuit disconnects and suctioning, q2-4h and PRN. Period increases in PEEP from 30 to 40 cm H20 for 30 to 40 sec

q6h interval, and PRN,100% FiO2 with minimum PEEP of 10cmH2O or appropriately optimized PEEP (do not reduce PEEP if at higher level). Recruitment maneuver prior to challenge ABG tolerated. ABGs to be taken after 10 minutes. May repeat oxygen challenge PRN
